meanings.sent1: The cake looked very tempting with its colorful frosting.
meanings.sent2: The shiny new toy was so tempting that the child couldn't resist playing with it.
meanings.sent3: The tempting smell of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen, making everyone hungry.
meanings.sent4: The tempting offer to buy one get one free was too good to pass up.
meanings.sent5: The tempting idea of taking a day off and relaxing by the beach seemed like a dream come true.

meanings.sent1: The tempting aroma of the sizzling bacon drew everyone to the breakfast table.
meanings.sent2: The shop window displayed tempting items that caught the attention of passersby.
meanings.sent3: The tempting display of chocolates at the store made it hard to resist buying some.
meanings.sent4: The tempting melody of the music lured people to the dance floor.
meanings.sent5: The tempting offer of a free trial made the product seem more appealing.

meanings.definition: Causing a desire to do something, especially something unwise or wrong
meanings.sent1: The tempting idea of skipping work and going to the beach crossed his mind.
meanings.sent2: The tempting thought of cheating on the test lingered in her mind, but she resisted.
meanings.sent3: The tempting opportunity to take a shortcut through the park seemed too good to be true.
meanings.sent4: The tempting prospect of getting rich quick led him to make risky investments.
meanings.sent5: The tempting offer to join the secret club made him curious about what they did.
